title: 'Smash' print editorial design, sans-serif, humanist
content:
This image comes from a print run called ['Smash' by Collectif Shebam](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904/http:/www.shebam.net/194176/947743/rfrences/smash).

One of the font families is Museo; what's the other font family?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown-4_6719.jpeg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown-3_5501.jpeg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown-2_3898.jpeg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown_4669.jpeg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown-6_5821.jpeg)
author: yoshimura

comments.content:
The other one is ' [BNPP Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904/http:/www.christophe-badani.com/portfolio/bnp-paribas)' (link's not working when posting), bespoke typeface by Typophage Christophe Badani and exclusive for BNP Paribas.

EDIT: sorry just seen it's a [duplicate](http://web.archive.org/web/20140325150904/http:/typophile.com/node/114047)...
